inventory.commentary: Examples and definitions revised a little by ahouston Added idiomatic phrases: on_the_road, down_the_road, travel_one's_own_road

sense.name: physical path or route, often paved
sense.commentary: ROAD[+physical][+route] an open way (generally public) for travel or transportation
sense.examples: Follow that road for fifteen miles. I live on Lacey Road. We saw a jack rabbit running down the road. They're building a new road and the construction is causing traffic.

sense.name: means or method of achieving something
sense.commentary: ROAD[+activity][+method][+purposive] a way or means to achieve something
sense.examples: The road to fame is often bumpy. They think the road to success lies in innovating new products faster than the competition. The CEO is leading his company down the road to ruin.

sense.name: to be traveling
sense.examples: The band is on the road at least six months out of the year. The team is on the road this week, playing in New York and Miami.

sense.name: in, or pertaining to, the future
sense.examples: There may be some difficulties down the road with this initiative. I think Mary will gain some perspective on this relationship down the road.

sense.name: pursue, or adhere to, a specific approach or manner
sense.examples: They encourage the students to travel their own road. As an orphan she mostly had to travel her own road. Each nation must travel its own road to democracy.
